intro: Gyrandra tenuifolia, commonly known as slender leaf star grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a low-growing perennial that spreads by stolons, forming dense mats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
